node.text:
From a very early age, African-American civil rights icon and #UnitedNations leader, Ralph Bunche understood the pain and peril of racism.

Yet Bunche turned those experiences into a catalyst for change on the international stage, pursuing a legendary career as one of the most senior diplomatic officials of his time. 

From walking side-by-side with Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., to working for peace as a UN mediator in Palestine, watch and learn more about the Nobel Prize Laureate. 

#FightRacism

node.title: Hero for Justice on the World's Stage

node.text:
"Because of climate change we are seeing even more intense storms, rising sea levels and many deaths. But we don’t have to accept this – we can act - and we must act as a matter of justice."

Environmentalist Sunita Narain explains why it's important that all of us #ActNow to achieve the goals of the #ParisAgreement. 

"Every country, rich or poor, is exposed to extreme weather. We need to build better and more resilient infrastructure – from electricity grids to roads, bridges and buildings. All these approaches are set out in the Paris Climate Agreement – adopted by nearly 200 countries. We can do it – we must do it – and we must act quickly."

From recycling to using less energy and water to opting for public transport, each and every one of us can take little steps in our everyday lives that can have a big impact. Tell us in the comments what you are doing to protect our planet.

#ClimateAction #GlobalGoals

node.text:
"We don’t have to choose between using energy and protecting the planet."

@unep Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee explains the role sustainable energy plays in building a better future for all. 
 
"Imagine a world where every job is based on clean, renewable energy – and where wind and solar are even more abundant. And where energy is affordable and reliable – and available to everyone. This might sound like a fantasy – but it’s achievable and we know how to get there."

The #ParisAgreement on the climate emergency is our roadmap for moving to a low-carbon economy and achieving a sustainable future. Since this international #ClimateAction treaty opened for signature 5 years ago, almost 200 countries have signed on to tackle the climate crisis together to limit global warming to protect people and planet.

 #GlobalGoals #ActNow

node.text:
Cities are major contributors to the climate crisis, but also an important hub for #ClimateAction.

@UNEP Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee explains what a green future for cities could look like & how the #ParisAgreement can help us get there.

node.text: Meet @unep Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee. She's a Kenyan engineer taking #ClimateAction and helping to #BeatPlasticPollution by recycling plastic waste into building materials.

node.text:
"My warmest wishes to everyone celebrating #EidAlFitr," #UnitedNations Secretary-General @antonioguterres said on Wednesday.

"I was delighted to mark the end of Ramadan with Asia El-Sayeed Ali, a Yemeni health worker helping malnourished children and mothers in a @worldfoodprogramme-supported nutrition clinic.

Asia personifies core values of Ramadan: compassion and empathy. Her resilience in the face of the devastating conflict in Yemen, as well as her life-saving work in support of people in desperate need have moved me greatly.

As #Ramadan comes to an end, let us continue drawing inspiration from its many lessons of solidarity that are celebrated during this Holy Month."

Regram: @antonioguterres

node.text:
Regram: @antonioguterres

Young people are the most affected by the climate decisions taken today. Their ideas, voices and actions are crucial to deliver meaningful and ambitious #ClimateAction for all.

@pcopaloma and @mahery_loha are two inspiring climate activists who exemplify the leadership and commitment of young people worldwide to address the most challenging problems we face today.

I'm grateful for our discussion and their insights on how to achieve the meaningful participation of youth, women and indigenous peoples as we tackle the climate crisis.

#ActNow #GlobalGoals

node.text:
@unep Goodwill Ambassador @aidanrgallagher describes how the #ParisAgreement can help us create a world free from the threats of the climate crisis. 

"This is personal for me," he explains. "I don’t want to choke on the air I breathe, or see wildfires burning out of control. So let’s keep working together. And you too can protect what is left and repair what has been damaged."

On Thursday's #EarthDay, @antonioguterres will be joining the U.S. Leaders’ Summit on Climate to reiterate his call for urgent #ClimateAction. 

"The Paris Agreement is our pact with our children, grandchildren & the whole human family," said the Secretary-General. 

"The climate crisis is the race of our lifetimes. We must go much further, and much faster."

#GenerationRestoration #ForNature

node.text: On Monday's International Day of Human Space Flight, @europeanspaceagency astronaut @thom_astro became the newest @fao Goodwill Ambassador. He will use his voice and unique perspective from space to advocate for #ClimateAction and to help reduce hunger.

node.title: French astronaut Thomas Pesquet becomes newest @fao Goodwill Ambassador

node.text:
All children have the right to a happy and healthy childhood, free from discrimination and full of love and acceptance. And acceptance begins at home. Every child should grow up in safe, loving and nurturing environment.

No child should suffer because of who they are. All children deserve protection and equal rights. Let's see kids the way they see themselves.

On Wednesday's International Transgender Day of Visibility, join @unaidsglobal in calling for the rights of transgender children to be protected.

#TransDayOfVisibility #SeeMeAsIAm

node.text:
Six years since the start of the conflict, millions of Yemenis are in need of humanitarian assistance. Over four million are displaced within the country. 

Our colleagues from UNHCR, the #UnitedNations Refugees Agency, are in #Yemen providing aid, but they cannot do it alone. 

Please click the link in the @refugees' bio to help. 

#YemenCantWait

node.text:
Maya (@ghazalmia) fled Damascus, #Syria at age 16 and overcame numerous barriers to become the world’s first female Syrian refugee pilot. 

Check out her inspiring story!

#WithRefugees

node.title: Meet Maya Ghazal, the newest @refugees Goodwill Ambassador

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on August 30, 2021. May be a cartoon of one or more people.

node.text:
Tuesday is the first-ever International Day for People of African Descent, an opportunity to celebrate the extraordinary contributions of the African diaspora around the world and recommit to eliminating all forms of discrimination against people of #AfricanDescent. 

This International Day "is a long overdue recognition of the profound injustices and systemic discrimination that people of African descent have endured for centuries, and continue to confront today," said #UnitedNations Secretary-General @antonioguterres, adding that it is also "an urgent call to action for everyone, everywhere, to commit to rooting out the evil of racism."

"Together, let us commit to do our part and advance the promise of equality, justice and dignity for all."

From speaking up and spreading words of tolerance and compassion to engaging in constructive discussions and volunteering in support of vulnerable groups, all of us can do our part to #StandUp4HumanRights and #FightRacism, discrimination and hatred.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on August 30, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and outdoors.

node.text:
#Throwback to 2016, when visitors threw flowers into the Río de la Plata at Memorial Park in Buenos Aires, #Argentina, to honour the memory of those who disappeared during the country's 1976-1983 military dictatorship. 

Monday is the International Day of the Victims of Enforced Disappearances.

Enforced disappearance is a serious human rights violation that has frequently been used as a strategy to spread terror and insecurity. Hundreds of thousands of people have vanished during conflicts or periods of repression. 

Families and societies have the right to know the truth about what happened to those that disappeared.

"States must fulfil their obligations to prevent enforced disappearance, to search for the victims, and to investigate, prosecute and punish the perpetrators," said #UnitedNations Secretary-General @antonioguterres.

"Together, we can and we must end all enforced disappearances."

📷: UN Photo/Mark Garten

#StandUp4HumanRights

node.text:
Believe victims.
Don’t excuse perpetrators.
Don’t joke about gender-based violence. 

It's time to stop using language that blames victims, objectifies women and normalizes sexual harassment. 

Each of us can take small actions that can have a big impact when it comes to ending violence against women. 

Regram: @unwomen 

#GenerationEquality #GlobalGoals

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on August 29, 2021. May be an image of outdoors and monument.

node.text:
The "Good Defeats Evil" Sculpture was presented to the #UnitedNations by the Soviet Union in 1990. It depicts St. George slaying a dragon created from fragments of Soviet SS-20 and United States Pershing nuclear missiles.

Sunday is the International Day against Nuclear Tests. 

Since 1945, more than 2,000 nuclear tests have been conducted by at least eight countries, with profound, harmful and long-lasting effects on human health, the environment, and the economic development of some of the world’s most fragile regions. 

Nuclear testing is a relic of another age that has no place in the 21st century.

"The International Day Against Nuclear Tests is an opportunity to reaffirm our commitment to outlaw all nuclear tests, by anyone, anywhere. There is no excuse to delay achieving this goal," said UN Secretary-General @antonioguterres. 

📷: UN Photo / Manuel Elias

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on August 28, 2021. May be an image of child and body of water.

node.text:
Children, like this little one in #Burundi, are paying the highest price in places where the climate crisis is exacerbating extreme weather.

Reduced emissions and investments in climate adaptation are urgently needed to ensure children's health and wellbeing. 

Each of us has a role to play and can #ActNow to protect our one and only planet.

Share in the comments below how you are taking #ClimateAction in your everyday life to ensure our shared future! 

Regram: @unicef I 📷: UNICEF/UN0436094/Prinsloo

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on August 28, 2021. May be an image of 2 people, child, people sitting, tree and outdoors.

node.text:
Meet 30-year-old Aisha and her youngest child, Maimuna, from #Nigeria. 

As a mother of 10, Aisha has become the sole support of her children since her husband was killed. Thanks to the support from the @worldfoodprogramme (WFP) the young mother receives monthly food rations and nutrition supplements for her children.

In northeast Nigeria, around 775,000 people are at severe risk of catastrophic food insecurity—the worst outlook in years. Without sustained humanitarian assistance, millions will struggle to feed themselves during this year's critical lean season. 

The #UnitedNations and humanitarian partners are on the ground to provide emergency response to those most in need. But additional funding is critical to address increasing needs.

Regram: un_ocha I 📷 UNOCHA/Damilola Onafuwa

#GlobalGoals #ZeroHunger

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on August 27, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'BEFORE YOU SHARE, THINK: WHO made it? WHAT is the source? WHERE did it come from? WHY are you sharing this? WHEN was it published? #TAKECAREBEFOREYOUSHARE'.

node.text:
Amid #COVID19, misinformation is causing global harm and can be deadly.

But all of us can do something about it. Before you share content online, #PledgeToPause and take time to verify facts about the post:

WHO made it?
WHAT is the source?
WHERE did it come from?
WHY are you sharing it?
WHEN was it published?

Help stop the spread of misinformation -- and the virus.

#takecarebeforeyoushare

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on August 27, 2021. May be an image of outdoors and monument.

node.text:
A view of the #UnitedNations Secretariat building and the garden at UN Headquarters in #NYC. In the foreground you can see the sculpture 'Consciousness', created by Mongolian artist Ochirbold Ayurzana and gifted to the UN by the Government of #Mongolia. 

The sculpture has footprints embedded on its reflective surface and depicts humanity's relationship with the Earth.

"Human well-being lies in protecting the health of the planet. It’s time to re-evaluate and reset our relationship with nature," UN Secretary-General @antonioguterres said earlier this year. 

From bringing your own shopping bags and refillable water bottles to cooking sustainable recipes and wasting less food, all of us can take #ClimateAction in our everyday lives.

Tell us in the comments below what you are doing to make #PeaceWithNature. 

📷: UN Photo / Mark Garten

#ActNow #GlobalGoals

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on August 26, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'I'm following with grave concern the situation at Kabul's airpor & condemn today's horrific terrorist attack. The incident underscores the volatility of Afghanistan, but also strengthens our resolve as we continue to deliver urgent assistance to the Afghan people.'.

node.text:
Regram: @antonioguterres

I'm following with great concern the situation at Kabul’s airport & condemn today’s terrorist attack.

The incident underscores the volatility of the situation in #Afghanistan, but also strengthens our resolve as we continue to deliver urgent assistance to the Afghan people.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on August 26, 2021. May be an image of dog.

node.text:
Meet our four-legged UN colleagues from around the world. 

As explosive detection dogs, demining dogs, and therapy dogs, these #K9s have many important jobs to do for the #UnitedNations. On Thursday's #DogDay we want to thank them and their handlers for their hard work all year round.

➡️ Scroll through to see more of our canine colleagues in action, including a few of our explosive detection dogs, who live and work with their specially-trained handlers around the world, and Chloe, the UN therapy dog. 

📷: UN Photo / Jean-Marc Ferré, Loey Felipe, Francisco Quilez; UNMAS / Martine Perret

#GlobalGoals #dogs

node.text:
Six athletes. Six inspiring stories. One goal: to represent refugees from all over the world at the @paralympics. 

Competing in #Tokyo2020, the Refugee Paralympic Team is showcasing how sport can help heal, bring hope and build a more inclusive world. 

Regram: @refugees

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on August 25, 2021. May be an image of nature, mountain and body of water.

node.text:
A waterfall flows amid a scenic landscape at Kirkjufell in #Iceland.

This beautiful photo was taken by Igor Popovic as part of the annual calendar competition organized by the World Meteorological Organization (WMO).

WMO works to ensure international cooperation on weather, climate and water issues. 

Photos for this year's competition for the 2022 calendar are being accepted through 15 September. 

Regram: @wmo_omm | 📷: Igor Orlov
